alert.note: Alert for Hitchcock; Red Willow (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Wallace County in west central Kansas, Cheyenne and Thomas Counties in northwestern Kansas, Logan County in west central Kansas, Rawlins, western Sheridan, western Decatur and Sherman Counties in northwestern Kansas, western Gove County in west central Kansas, southwestern Red Willow and southeastern Hitchcock Counties in southwestern Nebraska through 1030 PM MDT/1130 PM CDT/... At 1000 PM MDT/1100 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles northwest of Atwood to 4 miles southwest of Colby to near Russell Springs. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Colby and Atwood around 1105 PM CDT. Ludell around 1110 PM CDT. Gem around 1115 PM CDT. Herndon around 1120 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Rexford and Menlo. This includes Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 10 and 95. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Goodland.
